title: Here's what's new to Hulu in July 2022, and what's leaving; New seasons of 'What We Do in the Shadows' and 'Solar Opposites' are on the way, along with 'The Bob's Burgers Movie' and every season of 'The Americans'
text:
The Disney DIS-owned streaming service also has a new season of the twisted but hilarious, aliens-among-us animated comedy "Solar Opposites" (July 13) from "Rick and Morty" co-creator Justin Roiland and Mike McMahan, creator of Paramount+'s "Star Trek: Lower Decks."

There's also "Maggie" (July 6), a new comedy series about a psychic whose visions complicate her dating life, starring Rebecca Rittenhouse; and a pair of original movies, "The Princess" (July 1), an action/fantasy/comedy starring Joey King, and "Not Okay" (July 29), starring Zoey Deutch as a wannabe influencer who gets caught up in a huge lie.

Also: What's coming in July to Netflix | Amazon's Prime Video | HBO Max

Other notable additions include the fourth and final season of "Killing Eve" (July 10), the new season of "The Bachelorette" (July 19), the recently released "The Bob's Burgers Movie" (July 12), Season 2 of the anthology series "American Horror Stories" (July 21), and the complete series of the FX spy drama "The Americans" (July 29). Also on tap are movies such as "Any Given Sunday," "Bohemian Rhapsody," "Sexy Beast," "Sorry to Bother You" and "Working Girl" (all July 1).

Here's a full list of what's coming and going, as of June 22 (release dates are subject to change):
